dataBlock.description:
A boy dashes out of the #woods^, returning to the #village^. He freezes in play when he spots you.
Boy: "You— You're the man that rescued me from the Wicked Witch all those years ago. You're Geralt, aren't you? It's me, #Jack^. I need your help again."
To @talk^ to #Jack^, type "talk jack" and hit ENTER.
If you need a @hint^, type either "hint" or "help" and hit ENTER.
#Jack^ follows you, but is unwilling to leave the #woods^ and Joss behind.
dataBlock.detailedDescription: Jack looks desprate, gasping in panic-breaths.
#Jack^ looks useasy about returning to the #village^.
dataBlock.dialogue:
Another witch has come to haunt these #woods^, and Joss is missing. He may be a rotten old soul, but he's a neighbor. If we just let her have him, who knows whom she'll make off with next? Follow me. We need to @go^ back into the #woods^ to find Joss.
To @go^ into the #woods^, type 'go woods' and hit ENTER.
We should @go^ back to the #woods^ to look for Joss.

dataBlock.description:
#Jack^ leads you on, being careful not to get too far ahead of you.
Jack: "I heard the howls of wolves two nights ago coming from these woods. I haven't seen Joss since that afternoon. I've been looking for a sign, but nothing seems to point to where he might be. Perhaps a witcher like you could @check^ out the surroundings and find a clue."
To @check^ something out, type "check" followed by the name of the thing you want to @check^ and hit ENTER.
To @check^ the #bushes^, type "check bushes" and hit ENTER.
dataBlock.detailedDescription: He looks around at the tree tops.
dataBlock.dialogue: Don't look at me! I've been searching for a sign all day.

dataBlock.description:
#Jack^ is caught in the thorns.
Jack: "Ouch! I can't make it any further. Here, @take^ my #torch^. You can @use^ it to light up dark places."
To @take^ the #torch^, type "take torch" and hit ENTER.
dataBlock.detailedDescription: He is too weak to make it through the thorns.
dataBlock.dialogue: I'm going back to the village. I'll leave it to you to find Joss.
